com.clearblade.platform.api

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clearblade.platform.api.Query

  • public class Query
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists exclusively of instance methods that operate on ClearBlade Collections and Items.

    ClearBlade Query are objects that can query Cloud platform collections for Items. A typical example would be: 

     
                Query query = new Query(collectionId);
                query.equalTo("firstName", "John").greaterThan("age",40);
                query.fetch(new DataCallback(){
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Clyde Byrd, Aaron Allsbrook
    See Also:
    Item, Query, ClearBladeException

      Constructs a new Query object for modifying a collection A collection id must be set

      Constructs a new Query object for modifying a collection

    • Method Detail

      • equalTo

        public Query equalTo(java.lang.String field,
                     java.lang.Object value)
        Creates an equality clause in the query object 
         Query query = new Query(collectionId);
 query.equalTo('name', 'John');
 query.fetch(new DataCallback{
          public void done(QueryResponse resp){
       //your logic here
    }
 });
 //will only match if an item has an attribute 'name' that is equal to 'John'
        Parameters:
        field - - name of the column to be used for query criteria
        value - - the value of the search criteria
        Returns:
        modified Query object for chaining purposes.

        public void setPageNum(int pageNum)

 query.setPageNum(2);
 query.fetch(new DataCallback{
          public void done(QueryResponse resp){
       //your logic here
    }
 });
        Parameters:
        field - - name of the column to be used for sorting in descending manner

      • fetch

        public void fetch(DataCallback callback)
        Executes the query built by the Query Class. Will return a QueryResponse object which contains an array of the Items, and pagination information 
         Query query = new Query(collectionId);
 query.offset(75);
 query.fetch(new DataCallback{
          public void done(QueryResponse resp){
       //your logic here
    }
          public void error(ClearBladeException exception){
                 //error handling
    }
 });
        Parameters:
        callback - - a DataCallback to be called upon success/failure of the query.

        Throws:

      • getFetchURLParameter

        public java.lang.String getFetchURLParameter()
        Internal only, made public for test and verification. Returns the query string parameter necessary to implement the fetch query
        Returns:
        String

      • getURLParameter

        public java.lang.String getURLParameter()
        Internal only, made public for test and verification. Returns the query string parameter necessary to implement the query
        Returns:
        String

      • addChange

        public void addChange(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.Object value)
        Adds a change set to the query. When update is run all of the changes are honored across the matching criteria
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the column to be modified
        value - - the new value to insert into the column

      • clearChanges

        public void clearChanges()
        Clears the changes currently set in they query. Update will perform no action after this is executed.

      • update

        public void update(DataCallback callback)
        Call an update on all items matching the query criteria to conform to the changes that have been added via the addChange method 
         Query query = new Query(collectionText.getText().toString());
        query.equalTo("name", "John");
        query.addChange("name", "Johan");
        query.update( new DataCallback() {
        Parameters:
        callback -
